widget.name: WinJS.UI.AppBarCommand
widget.description: Represents a command to display in an AppBar.

property.name: id
property.description: Gets or sets the ID of the AppBarCommand.

property.name: type
property.description: Gets or sets the type of the AppBarCommand. Possible values are "button", "toggle", "flyout", or "separator".

property.name: label
property.description: Gets or sets the label of the AppBarCommand.

property.name: icon
property.description: Gets or sets the icon of the AppBarCommand.

property.name: onclick
property.description: Gets or sets the function to invoke when the command is clicked.

property.name: flyout
property.description: For flyout-type AppBarCommands, this property returns the WinJS.UI.Flyout that this command invokes. When setting this property, you may also use the String ID of the flyout to invoke, the DOM object for the flyout, or the WinJS.UI.Flayout object itself.

property.name: section
property.description: Gets or sets the section that the AppBarCommand is in. Possible values are "selection" and "global".

property.name: tooltip
property.description: Gets or sets the tooltip text of the AppBarCommand.

property.name: selected
property.description: Set or get the selected state of a toggle button.

property.name: element
property.description: The DOM element that hosts the AppBarCommad.

property.name: disabled
property.description: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the AppBarCommand is disabled. A value of true disables the AppBarCommand, and a value of false enables it.

property.name: hidden
property.description: Gets a value that indicates whether the AppBarCommand is hiding or in the process of becoming hidden. A value of true indicates that the AppBarCommand is hiding or in the process of becoming hidden.

property.name: firstElementFocus
property.description: Gets or sets the HTMLElement within a "content" type AppBarCommand that should receive focus whenever focus moves via Home or the arrow keys, from the previous AppBarCommand to the this AppBarCommand. Returns the AppBarCommand object's host element by default.

property.name: lastElementFocus
property.description: Gets or sets the HTMLElement within a "content" type AppBarCommand that should receive focus whenever focus would move, via End or arrow keys, from the next AppBarCommand to this AppBarCommand. Returns this AppBarCommand object's host element by default.

property.name: extraClass
property.description: Adds an extra CSS class during construction.
